item.title: Damaged pavement, 15th July
item.description:
I tripped over damaged paving which cut my head open severely and resulted in me laying in the road covered in blood. I was with my child who was hysterical as I was dazed. A neighbour came out to help and my son ran to get his nan who’s house we was walking back from. An ambulance was called and they assessed and took a statement. My partner had to leave work early to take me to the hospital resulting in him loosing money. I was sent to hospital where I got stitches. I have a huge scar and black eye. The location are outside Bancroft house, Woodside Crescent DA15. The neighbour that helped lives at Rosalyn house Woodside Crescent DA15. I live at 15 Woodside Crescent DA15 7JJ. I have photos of it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Woodside Crescent, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gate in Peabody estate alley between Blocks C/D not closing, 15th July
item.description:
The gate to the estate stops the public using the alley as a public toilet. It’s being chained open by a resident. It’s a major health hazard as there’s daily faeces and urine in the alley. It would be healthier to have the gate closed so only estate residents have access via key fob.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Kemble Street, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkdale Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned and/or Nuisance Vehicle, 15th July
item.description:
This motorcar and/or remnants of the aforesaid motorcar, namely a BLUE, 2009 RENAULT CLIO GT (128) (YC59ZRN) 1598cc, Petrol, 3DR, Hatchback, Manual appears to be abandoned within Culdesac 203-225 Kidbrooke Park Road SE3. This aforesaid vehicle has been in place in excess of 21 Calendar Days. This motorcar is lifted with one wheel (Front NearSide) removed and/or absent with rusted bearings and/or suspension related components exposed. The motor has both rear lamps removed and/or exposed electrical components. The interior of the motorcar appears to be severely laden with waste, car hand book and/or components. This motorcar has also the rear bumper totally removed and/or absent from being attached from the aforesaid motorcar. This motor therefore appears to be abandoned and most importantly not road worthy and/or fit to be on the public highway in such conditions constituting to a visual nuisance and Grace danger to vulnerable young individuals such as children who may venture beneath the vehicle which appears to raised and/or unstable on three wheels at risk of collapsing without adequate safety measures to prevent its collapse. The aforesaid motorcar is a risk to local and/or visiting inhabitants guests and/or the general public especially being in close proximity to a school and located with a residential street. The aforesaid motorcar is NOT showing as INSURED. The aforesaid motorcar is showing as UNTAXED; tax DUE : 30 APRIL 2025; OVERDUE. The aforesaid motorcar is NOT FIT to be on the public highway in such conditions and/or permitted by statue law, relevant legislation and/or Act enshrined by Parliament.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 227, Kidbrooke Park Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The mattress dumped on Parkdale Road still there after the first report, 15th July
item.description:
Mattress dumped on the Parkdale Road just past after Chestnut/ Parkdale intersection. Along with the second one dumped a few meters down it is a health hazard, makes it difficult for people with disabilities and strollers to walk on the pavement safely. It is also probably collecting bacteria by the hour- a health hazard. Please pick it up before a third report. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkdale Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: No through road sign not readable, 15th July
item.description:
The road sign for Dunstan's Grove is very faded and worn. While you can still identify the road name, the "no through road" symbol is not really visible from Dunstan's Road. This means many, many cars speed down Dunstan's Grove each day, thinking it is a cut through to Forest Hill road avoiding the lights at the end of Dunstan's Road. As there is no turning space at the end of Dunstan's Grove all the cars then make multiple point turns and speed out of the cul de sac. This is not ideal as there is nursery at the end of Dunstan's Grove with young children and parents making their way to and from the nursery daily. Because it is a cul de sac pedestrians tend to be lulled in to a false sense of security that there will be no cars so don't take the care they should crossing the road. Cars in the road are also frequently bumped or dented by drivers making multiple point turns having mistakenly entered Dunstan's Grove.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Dunstan's Grove, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
